metadata.name: De/FragV2 #306
metadata.description:
The second piece in this series is dedicated to another fundamental algorithm in computer graphics: Voronoi. It's origin precedes its use with computers by several decades, or centuries, depending on who to credit, since science always is a continuum. In the generative art & design field, the algorithm has been an instrumental tool for generation(s) of practioners, sadly often to the point of turning cliché.

In this piece I've attempted to "break" the classic resulting aesthetics of this algorithm and focus more on revealing its inner workings. There are many ways of computing a Voronoi diagram. The so called Jump Flood Algorithm (JFA) proved to be the visually most interesting approach to me. Again, as with the previous De/Frag piece, here the algorithm has been slowed down, timesliced and customized in dozens of ways to result in a more painterly character overall and produce a variety of new shapes & textures.

Fullscreen compatible (Press 'S' to toggle square frame). Made with love & thi.ng/umbrella

metadata.name: NFT #62
metadata.description:
This is NFT - Non-Fungible Token released at fxhash.xyz by Shvembldr.

This art is not resolution agnostic and may vary on different devices and screens.

It doesn't make any sense, it's just geometric shapes and moving dots. Sometimes it looks like a liquid splashing to the surface, sometimes it looks like nothing. But it's nice to watch (most of the time).

Buy it only if you like it!

Click = pause
S = save png
(Live Mode)

metadata.name: Virevent #33
metadata.description:
Discover hundreds of different pinwheels with fantastic shapes and colours.
Each one is a combination of two wheels, “inner” and “outer”, each having its own colour and shape.

This project is a combination of different techniques I’ve learnt from previous projects, principally curly curves and blending with additive or multiply mode. Thanks to p5js, the script is short but very smart.


Features: Amplitude, Texture, Inner colour, Outer colour, Inner Branches, Outer Branches, Loops
Colours: Silver, Coral, Yellow, Purple, Orange, Blue, Pistachio

Generated images are licenced under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/)

metadata.name: Poems in the Public Domain #236
metadata.description:
POEMS IN THE PUBLIC DOMAIN [PITPD] represents a new form of poetic anthology—one that celebrates the role of the reader in shaping the life of a poem. In this unique art piece, 14 readers take turns discovering 30 classic poems. We invite collectors to explore this compendium, selected to present a diverse, engaging archive that acknowledges the importance of certain seminal works in shaping our collective unconscious. 

Inspired by Roland Barthe's maxim, "those who fail to reread are obliged to read the same story everywhere," each reader is represented by multiple pen colors & new marginalia, suggesting the crucial act of rereading. 

The verses vanish, just like our memory of their exact words might fade, but distilled, standout moments of personal connection remain. In time, even these wane, providing a scarcely perceptible backdrop as the poem is discovered & interpreted anew. 

PITPD explores authorship. When a poem enters the public domain, it no longer belongs to its author but to its readers. In the intimate moments we read a poem, we link it to our private, pulsating worlds & help ensure others will read it, too. If history’s palms hadn’t held Sappho’s words, our fingers wouldn’t hold them now. 

Readers write poetry’s survival. 

Each iteration of PITPD traces a narrative that can play for hours without repeating. Some 89% of iterations chronicle the life of a single poem, while 11% include multiple poems, intentionally surveying intertextuality. Taking advantage of the generative medium, embodied readership is represented via dynamic handwriting, dancing markings, algorithmic paper aging, coded stains, & other effects.

Spacebar pauses & resumes the animation. Refreshing the browser window restarts it. For those interested in the underlying code, please open the browser console. This collection’s ciphers, too, are in the public domain.

Additional information can be found in the companion article on fx(text): fxhash.xyz/article/poems-in-the-public-domain-marginalia-as-living-verse

metadata.name: BRUTAL Larvas #113
metadata.description:
🐛 × 🟦

Brutalist movement had an impact on larvas too.
This happens when they finally meet those brutal pixels!

• A collaboration between DOS Larvas and Cloudnoise •

Features:
🐛 6 colour palettes
🟦 24 heads
🐛 24 faces
🟦 24 ears

Press 's' to download your own brutal larva!

metadata.name: Effluence #212
metadata.description:
“Through our eyes, the universe is perceiving itself. Through our ears, the universe is listening to its harmonies. We are the witnesses through which the universe becomes conscious of its glory, of its magnificence.”

-Alan Wilson Watts


---

Depending on the feature values, this artwork may take several seconds to render.
A modern, capable computer is advised.

To download image at different resolutions, press keys:

1. Low
2. Mid
3. High

---

10 first people minting at auction start price can request high-quality print at no additional cost (DM on Twitter for more details if interested)

Made with p5.js, curiosity and goodwill.

---

Daniel Aguilar
October 2022

Twitter: @protozoo
Instagram: @prtzart
Website: https://protozoo.xyz

metadata.name: GEN XYZ Das Occult #5283
metadata.description:
A 10k Generative Profile Pic collection
GEN XYZ Das Occult - by culla - @tamccullough

move over cryptopunks
there is a new group on the scene

100% code - not an image composition

A bunch of common palettes
A selection of rare palettes
And a smaller set of ultra rare palettes
However, rarity will be based on what combinations the code produces

The majority of tokens will not have a special trait
However your token might have one or even multiple special traits
But, be aware that only the last special trait added will be listed in the features

Even then, look closely, because not all aspects of the canvas are included in the features. Collectors should still look closely and choose what they like when buying on secondary.

Which team are you on? X or O?

follow culla on twitter for updates. Or maybe __acolyte__

If the non reserved tokens mint out quickly, Access List mints will have 24 hours to mint reserves assigned to those wallets

Thank you for supporting an emerging artist in the generative art space

Access List reserves were given to holders of the following PFP collections created by culla
2x for each Basqunk held
1x for each Inkspunk, TwoFourQunk, V0iD, DeeManz, Punkasso and CR0$$KULL
You would have needed to transfer the above tokens to your mint wallet at the time of the snapshot

share your tokens on social media with #genxyznft
Made with love by culla using p5.js
